docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay -- Uruguay joined the "stabilization club" of Latin-American countries fighting inflation last year.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay -- Uruguay joined the "stabilization club" of Latin-American countries fighting inflation last year.
docs.abstract: Econ rev and forecast; stabilization program fights runaway inflation

headline.main: URUGUAY FIGHTS TO CURB INFLATION; Gets $30,000,000 Credit as She Agrees to Embark on a Sound-Money Policy

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile -- Chile's plans to check inflation and stabilize the economy, instituted by President Jorge Alessandri, were severely shaken early last year, but they are firm as a rock today.
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile -- Chile's plans to check inflation and stabilize the economy, instituted by President Jorge Alessandri, were severely shaken early last year, but they are firm as a rock today.

headline.main: CHILE REBOUNDING AFTER HEAVY JOLT; Development Plans Pushed Following Earthquakes Chile's Economy Bounces Back After Heavy Earthquake Losses

byline.original: By CHARLES GRIFFIN Special to The New York Times

headline.main: TRADE FAIR FOR PERU; Second Pacific Exposition Will Be Held in Lima in Fall

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 11 (AP) -- The police stormed the headquarters of the Communist party today and seized 131 persons in a drive to check demonstrations supporting Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 11 (AP) -- The police stormed the headquarters of the Communist party today and seized 131 persons in a drive to check demonstrations supporting Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba.

headline.main: URUGUAYANS RAID REDS AND HOLD 131; Party Headquarters Invaded to Check Demonstrations in Support of Castro

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 12 -- The Uruguayan Government ordered tonight the expulsion of the Cuban Ambassador and the First Secretary of the Soviet Embassy.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 12 -- The Uruguayan Government ordered tonight the expulsion of the Cuban Ambassador and the First Secretary of the Soviet Embassy.
docs.abstract: Uruguay expells Cuban Amb Garcia Inchaustegul, linking him with USSR 1st Sec Samilov in local subversion; clashes and unrest preceding move discussed

headline.main: URUGUAY EXPELS ENVOY OF CASTRO; Soviet Embassy Aide Also Told to Go -- Move Follows Raid on Reds' Center URUGUAY EXPELS ENVOY OF CASTRO

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Jan. 13 -- The expulsion yesterday of the Cuban Ambassador and a Soviet diplomat has sharply defined the political lines in this little democracy, which is considered among South America's most poltically and socially advanced.

docs.abstract: Uruguayan pol split grows over ouster of Garcia

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Jan. 14 -- The expulsion by Uruguay of the Cuban Ambassador, Mario Garcia Inchaustegui, has brought an angry reaction from the Cuban Government.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 14 -- President Arturo Frondizi believes that an attempt by President-elect John F. Kennedy's incoming Administration and Premier Fidel Castro's regime to negotiate on Cuban-United States differences would be looked on with favor...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 14 -- President Arturo Frondizi believes that an attempt by President-elect John F. Kennedy's incoming Administration and Premier Fidel Castro's regime to negotiate on Cuban-United States differences would be looked on with favor by Latin America.
